閉.definition: to close; to stop up; to shut; to obstruct

閉口不談.definition: to refuse to say anything about (idiom); to remain tight-lipped; to avoid mentioning

閉合.definition: to close by coming together (like the lips of a wound, the doors of an elevator, the walls of a channel); to close by connecting in a loop (like a circuit); closed-loop

閉嘴.definition: Shut up!; same as 閉上嘴巴|闭上嘴巴

閉域.definition: closed domain; algebraically closed field (math.), e.g. complex number field 複數域|复数域[fu4 shu4 yu4]

閉塞.definition: to stop up; to close up; hard to get to; out of the way; inaccessible; unenlightened; blocking

閉塞眼睛捉麻雀.pinyin: bi4 se4 yan3 jing1 zhuo1 ma2 que4
閉塞眼睛捉麻雀.definition: lit. to catch sparrows blindfolded (idiom); fig. to act blindly

閉幕.definition: the curtain falls; lower the curtain; to come to an end (of a meeting)

閉幕詞.definition: closing speech (at the conclusion of a conference, sports tournament etc)

閉月羞花.definition: lit. hiding the moon, shaming the flowers (idiom); fig. female beauty exceeding even that of the natural world

閉目塞聽.definition: to shut one's eyes and stop one's ears; out of touch with reality; to bury one's head in the sand

閉目養神.definition: to relax with one's eyes closed

閉門塞竇.definition: to close doors and block openings (idiom); mounting a strict defense

閉門思過.definition: shut oneself up and ponder over one's mistakes

閉門羹.definition: see 吃閉門羹|吃闭门羹[chi1 bi4 men2 geng1]

閉門覓句.definition: lit. lock the door and search for the right word (idiom); fig. the serious hard work of writing

閉門造車.definition: lit. to shut oneself away and build a cart (idiom); fig. to work on a project in isolation, without caring for outside realities

閉關.definition: to close the passes; to seal off the country; seclusion (monastic practice, e.g. of Chan Buddhists)

閉關自守.definition: close the country to international intercourse

閉關鎖國.definition: to close the passes and seal off the country; to close a country to exclude foreign contact

閉館.definition: (of libraries, museums etc) to be closed

閉麥.definition: to switch one's microphone to "mute"; (fig.) to go silent
